entry.def: A workhorse is a horse which is used to do a job, for example to pull a plough.

entry.tran: 吃苦耐劳的人;老黄牛;重负荷机器
entry.def: If you describe a person or a machine as a workhorse, you mean that they can be relied upon to do a large amount of work, especially work that is dull or routine.

example.ex: ...the Wellington bomber, the great workhorse of the war...
example.tran: 在战争中立下汗马功劳的威灵顿轰炸机

example.ex: My husband never even looked at me. I was just a workhorse bringing up three children.
example.tran: 我丈夫甚至从不看我一眼。我只是个任苦任劳养育3个孩子的机器。

means.word_mean: 1. machine that performs dependably under heavy use;

sentences.sentence: "the IBM main frame computers have been the workhorse of the business world"

means.word_mean: 2. a horse used for plowing and hauling and other heavy labor
